skillTree.localised_description: True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

skillTree.localised_description: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

skillTree.localised_description: The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

skillTree.localised_description: The roar of a Manticore is guaranteed to send mortals fleeing, for they know a creature of terror is abroad.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

skillTree.localised_description: The War Altar of Hekarti stands as a twisted monument to the dark goddess of magic and sorcery, a sinister fusion of arcane power and malevolent intent. Perched atop the altar is a grotesque statue of Hekarti herself, her features twisted into a malevolent sneer.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases when nearby allies or enemies cast spells.

skillTree.localised_description: It is easy to favour Hekarti - who pays close attention to Elven desires - over Atharti, but only the foolish allow that to happen.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Bloody-handed God watches over his disciples.
Magic's dark mistress has a care for her dutiful acolytes.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When the Witch King launched a war against his hated High Elf kin, Lilaeth fought at his side, leading a splinter army that pushed deep into Ulthuan, taking every opportunity to rampage through the land of their vile kindred.

effects.description: Replenishes 10% campaign movement range after winning a battle
Replenishes 10% campaign movement range after razing a settlement
Income from sacking High Elf settlements: +10%
Replenishes 20% campaign movement range after winning a battle
Replenishes 20% campaign movement range after razing a settlement
Income from sacking High Elf settlements: +20%
Replenishes 30% campaign movement range after winning a battle
Replenishes 30% campaign movement range after razing a settlement
Income from sacking High Elf settlements: +30%

skillTree.localised_description: As she charges into battle at the head of her legions, Lilaeth desires nothing more than to feel the crunch of High Elven bones beneath the wheels of her War Altar of Hekarti. Those who follow her harbour the same dread emotion in their chests.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +10% when fighting against High Elves
	(all armies factionwide)

Charge bonus: +20% when fighting against High Elves
	(all armies factionwide)

Charge bonus: +30% when fighting against High Elves
	(all armies factionwide)

Attribute: Glorious Charge when fighting against High Elves
	(all armies factionwide)

related_attributes.bullet_text:
When charging into an enemy unit:
	  Charge Bonus duration is doubled.
	 Enemy units take a  Leadership penalty as if they have been attacked in the flank.

skillTree.localised_description: Lilaeth has vowed the destruction of a great many foes, and has fought against them all besides, whether it be the hated High Elves, the miserable Skaven of the Underempire, the weak manlings of the Empire, or even the corrupted fools beholden to the Dark Gods. Not a one of them has stopped her in her path of destruction carved in hatred and in spite across the landscape, and none shall stop her now.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: -10
	(enemy armies in local province)

Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Dark Elves on a warpath care only for the cruelty they can inflict and the gold they can acquire, and will go to any lengths to acquire it.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Murderous Mastery" when in foreign territory
	(all units in army)

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

effects.description:
Disable passive ability: "Murderous Prowess" when in foreign territory
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: All those who die in Lilaeth's presence have their soul consumed and fed to the Dark Goddess, thereby to power rituals of sinister outcome. And to make Lilaeth great in the eyes of her patron deity.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

skillTree.localised_description: Unique amongst the wielders of Dark Magic, Lilaeth has learned to channel her own lifeforce into a grand destructive endeavour, able to wipe out almost an entire army, albeit at great cost to herself.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

skillTree.localised_description: The frozen heart of Lilaeth has never thawed, only growing more and more encrusted by entrapping shards of ice. Twisted though it is, it has given her a unique mastery of the bitter chill of winter.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: The ancient archives of Ghrond contain secrets that can preserve life - or annihilate it.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Magic is a most useful tool on the field of battle, but generally secondary in the face of good, old-fashioned brute force.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Dreadspears, Bleakswords, Black Ark Corsairs and Darkshards units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Marshalling missile troops effectively - even elites - is all about timing.

Reload time reduction: +8% for Darkshards, Black Ark Corsairs and Bolt Thrower units

skillTree.localised_description: The most effective raiders have a plan that is certain to succeed and stick to it; this one ensures that they do.

skillTree.localised_description: Judicious, or even not-so-judicious, use of the lash tends to get the desired results, so why hold back?

skillTree.localised_description: The ability to command the savage, untamed Cold Ones should not be underestimated - not everyone has the knack!

skillTree.localised_description: An elite even amongst elites, this accomplished warrior directs the cut-and-thrust of melee - a choreographer of death, you might say.

Melee attack: +4 for Witch Elves, Har Ganeth Executioners, Black Guard of Naggarond and Sisters of Slaughter units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who fail to make the grade don't just die, they're tortured and used for target practice!

Armour: +10 for Bleakswords, Dreadspears, Darkshards and Reaper Bolt Thrower units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: You'd think that pillaging the land would bring payment enough. You'd be wrong.

Armour: +10 for Black Ark Corsairs, Shades, Dark Riders, Doomfire Warlocks and Scourgerunner Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Range: +15% for Black Ark Corsairs, Shades, Dark Riders and Scourgerunner Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The gods help those who help themselves - raising them above the rank and file to elite status.

effects.description:
Armour: +5 for Black Guard of Naggarond, Har Ganeth Executioners, Cold One Knights, Cold One Dread Knights and Cold One Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The murderous, unforgiving rage of Khaine can be transferred from a Lord to his legions.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Witch Elves, Harpies, War Hydra, Kharibdyss, Black Dragon, Feral Manticore, Sisters of Slaughter and Bloodwrack Medusae units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
This one ensures that those captured in battle wished they'd died on the field, so great is the cruelty that awaits them.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
If there were annals detailing the dastardly deeds of the sackers and looters of the world, this inveterate brigand would feature heavily.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Knowing precisely where and when to launch an ambush, and against who, takes an unusual level of guile.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

factionEffects.localised_description: Wedded to Malekith and eager to please her husband and master, Lilaeth has spent many years seeking out and destroying High Elven colonies and outposts, preparing herself for the day she is ordered to assault Ulthuan itself. That day is finally here, and she has leapt at the prospect. The betrayers shall perish.

effects.description: Despoiler of Ulthuan: As Lilaeth marches across Ulthuan and conquers territory, benefits accrue to her faction.

Income from Iron Mines, Gold Mines and Marble Quarries: +30%
	(factionwide)

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases by each enemy unit in range with leadership wavering or lower.

items.colour_text: Carved from the blackest obsidian and adorned with runes of forbidden knowledge, the Binding of Malice pulses with a life of its own, hungering for the suffering of others. Dark energies coil and writhe along its length, forming sinister shards of blackened ice that catch the light, promising a cold death to any who disobey the bearer.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Word of Pain"
Spell number of uses: +1 for "Power of Darkness"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Word of Pain Upgraded"

target_if: Not on or below a platform

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Wedded to Malekith and eager to please her husband and master, Lilaeth has spent many years seeking out and destroying High Elven colonies and outposts, preparing herself for the day she is ordered to assault Ulthuan itself. That day is finally here, and she has leapt at the prospect. The betrayers shall perish.
